content: garter stitch comfort blanket this pattern is for a square baby blanket in garter stitch with an eyelet edging that s it simple in design it shows off those special yarns perfectly this pattern would be perfect for just-no-longer- beginners who want to pick up a pattern with the beginnings of lace yarn any dk weight yarn sample shown knitted using approximately 200g 450yds of dk weight superfine alpaca yarn 70% alpaca/30% bfl from uk alpacas colour way used is parchment needles & notions 5 00mm circulars are probably going to be easier as you end up knitting across the diagonal of the blanket tapestry needle for weaving in the ends gauge/gauge 12sts x 22 row 11 garter ridges in 10cm/4 on 5mm needles size chart depends on how much yarn you plan on using the sample shown at the gauge given measures 69cm 27 ¼ square techniques required  casting on  knitting  decreasing k3tog  yarn overs  binding off copyright ©magicmammoth 2013 page 1 of 2 abbreviations used k knit k3tog knit 3 together yo yarn over co cast on bobble bind off instructions before you start weigh your yarn it makes it much easier to remember when to start decreasing 1 co 2 sts turn 2 k1 yo k to end of row repeat step 2 until you have used up half of the yarn 3 k1 yo k3tog k to end of row repeat step 3 until you have 5 sts remaining on the needles 4 bobble 5 sts weave in all ends you can use the last end to create the final eyelet on the corner if you wish copyright ©magicmammoth 2013 page 2 of 2
